newsitem.title: FRANCE: French shares drop at start, Lagardere gains.
newsitem.headline: French shares drop at start, Lagardere gains.

text.p: French shares started 0.6 percent lower on Friday on the back of a drop on Wall Street, a lower dollar and an opinion poll giving the centre-right government a thin lead.
The CAC-40 index was down 0.51 percent at 2629.87 0807 GMT.

Lagardere Groupe gained 1.14 percent to 178 francs after it said on Wednesday it had lined up both British Aerospace Plc and Germany's Daimler-Benz Aerospace in its bid for the state's stake in Thomson-CSF. Alcatel-Alsthom, which is bidding jointly with Dassault Industries, was down 1.08 percent at 640 francs.
The Paris market was closed on Thursday for Ascension Day as well as to commemorate the end of World War Two.
An opinion poll on Thursday showed France's parliamentary election race growing even closer, with the left-wing opposition snapping at the heels of the ruling centre-right coalition.

The Ipsos survey for the weekly Le Point magazine projected the centre-right would get 290 of the National Assembly's 577 seats in the May 25-June 1 vote, just one more than is needed for a majority. The Socialists and their allies would win 264, the Communists 22 and the far-right National Front one seat.
